definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

sentences.chinese: 只留下一个冰冷的梦境。

sentences.english: Perhaps Images from the forthcoming cold heart would re-warm.
sentences.chinese: 乜许那颗即将冰冷旳心会重新温暖。

sentences.english: The cold stone of the mysterious obelisk guards its secrets.
sentences.chinese: 神秘方尖塔上的冰冷岩石保守着它的秘密。

sentences.english: Itis cold and foggy in London here of the year.
sentences.chinese: 在每年的这个期间，伦敦冰冷而多雾。

sentences.english: I was so scared that my blood ran cold .
sentences.chinese: 我真是给吓得手脚冰冷，魂不附体。

sentences.english: The freezing cold will last for three days at least, Guo said.
sentences.chinese: 郭说，冰冷天气将至少持续三天。

sentences.english: The sun so hot, I froze to death.
The first of what would turn out to be 10.8 million gal. of oil began to spew forth into the cold waters.
sentences.chinese: 1080万加仑的原油喷涌到冰冷的海水中。

sentences.english: Her hands were cold and shaky when she began to redden her lips and run a comb through her hair.
sentences.chinese: 当她开始涂口红和梳理头发时，她的双手冰冷发抖。

sentences.english: Raise Chu lanky iciness, the whole body of spirit shivers.
sentences.chinese: 翘楚手足冰冷，气的浑身颤抖。

sentences.english: He goes off in the ice-cold river water, for us a warm enlightenment.
sentences.chinese: 他在冰冷的河水中睡去，给我们一个温暖的启示。

sentences.english: He contented himself with wetting his eyes with the ice-cold water.
sentences.chinese: 他将就着用冰冷的水擦擦眼睛就算洗好了。

sentences.english: Interior organic cotton, exterior weather-resistant nylon fabric.
sentences.chinese: 内部是有机棉，外部是抵御冰冷气象的尼龙原料。

sentences.english: She was really afraid of the cold frog.
sentences.chinese: 她真的很害怕这只冰冷的青蛙。

sentences.english: For, lone, among the mountains cold.
I crossed my arms and felt my left arm was cold.
sentences.chinese: 我抱紧手臂，感到左臂一阵冰冷。

definition: cold and detached towards sb/lack of regard/indifference/neglect
to the bone/to the marrow/fig. to a very large degree
